metadata.title: CVE-2018-11039 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Spring Framework (versions 5.0.x prior to 5.0.7, versions 4.3.x prior to4.3.18, and older unsupported versions) allow web applications to changethe HTTP request method to any HTTP method (including TRACE) using theHiddenHttpMethodFilter in Spring MVC. If an application has a pre-existingXSS vulnerability, a malicious user (or attacker) can use this filter toescalate to an XST (Cross Site Tracing) attack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-11039` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libspring-aop-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-beans-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-context-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-context-support-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-core-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-expression-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-instrument-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-jdbc-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-jms-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-messaging-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-orm-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-oxm-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-test-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-transaction-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-web-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-web-portlet-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-web-servlet-java - 4.3.19-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libspring-java package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.3.19-1').
